agenda.description: SENATE NOTICE OF PUBLIC HEARING COMMITTEE: Business & Commerce TIME & DATE: 8:00 AM, Tuesday, April 9, 2019 PLACE: E1.012 (Hearing Room) CHAIR: Senator Kelly Hancock To be considered: SB 64 Nelson Relating to cybersecurity for information resources. SB 339 Huffman | et al. Relating to a seller's disclosure notice for residential property regarding floodplains, flood pools, or reservoirs. SB 491 Creighton Relating to certain government contracts with companies that boycott Israel. SB 662 Campbell Relating to the availability of personal information of a statewide elected official or member of the legislature. SB 819 Nelson Relating to state agency electronic information and processes. SB 939 Creighton Relating to the limitations periods for certain suits against real estate appraisers and appraisal firms. SB 1035 Taylor Relating to maximum liability limits for windstorm and hail insurance coverage provided through the Texas Windstorm Insurance Association. SB 1318 Johnson | et al. Relating to the availability of dates of birth under the public information law. SB 1502 Creighton Relating to the authority of certain insurers to make investments in bond exchange-traded funds. SB 1584 Hughes Relating to waiver of continuing education requirements for certain insurance adjusters. SB 1742 Menéndez Relating to physician and health care provider directories for certain health benefit plans. SB 1769 Taylor Relating to collection of taxes by the Texas Alcoholic Beverage Commission at certain ports of entry. SB 1778 Paxton Relating to excess loss damage waivers in connection with the lease of motor vehicles; providing a civil penalty. SB 1779 Paxton Relating to security for state agency information and information technologies. SB 1833 Alvarado Relating to the sale of certain wine by the holder of a wine and beer retailer's permit or mixed beverage permit. SB 1845 Miles Relating to the amendment of the dedicatory instruments of certain mixed-use real estate developments. SB 1883 Perry Relating to the authority of the Public Utility Commission of Texas to retain assistance for regional proceedings affecting certain electric utilities and consumers. SB 1949 Watson | et al. Relating to the applicability of Texas law to consumer financial transactions extended to persons located in this state at the time the transaction is entered into. SB 1958 Creighton Relating to financially impaired fraternal benefit societies. SB 2195 Lucio Relating to metering and billing requirements for certain apartment houses, manufactured homes, and recreational vehicles. SB 2304 Taylor Relating to eligibility to establish a multiple employer welfare arrangement. SB 2370 Hughes Relating to the procedure for approval of certain land development applications by a political subdivision. Pending Business Public testimony will be limited to 3 minutes. If submitting written testimony, please provide 20 copies to the committee clerk with your name and bill number on each copy. You may register for this hearing using the Senate kiosk located in the extension hallways or by going to http://swrs.
